CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 To obtain the oxidation potentials of the polymer films , the reference electrode was calibrated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) salt couple , whose redox potential is assumed to have an absolute energy level of -4.80 eV in a vacuum.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +) salt |

Explanation:

The material names in the paragraph are "ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +)" and "salt" which are mentioned together, so I included them as a single entity. The other material name is "a vacuum" which is not directly related to the context but mentioned for comparison purpose.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +) salt |

Explanation:

The only clear material name in the paragraph is "ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc +)" salt. The term "a vacuum" is not a material name, it is a state of matter, so I have removed it from the list.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 To obtain the oxidation potentials of the polymer films , the reference electrode was calibrated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) salt couple , whose redox potential is assumed to have an absolute energy level of -4.80 eV in a vacuum.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| oxidation potentials |
| redox potential |
| absolute energy level |

Explanation:

* "oxidation potentials" is mentioned as the property of the polymer films that is being obtained.
* "redox potential" is mentioned as the property of the ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc+) salt couple.
* "absolute energy level" is mentioned as the property of the redox potential of the ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc+) salt couple.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| oxidation potentials |
| redox potential |

Explanation:

* "oxidation potentials" is mentioned as the property of the polymer films that is being obtained.
* "redox potential" is mentioned as the property of the ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc+) salt couple.

"Absolute energy level" is not a material property, it is a property of a physical quantity, so it is not included in the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 To obtain the oxidation potentials of the polymer films , the reference electrode was calibrated using a ferrocene / ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc + ) salt couple , whose redox potential is assumed to have an absolute energy level of -4.80 eV in a vacuum.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| -4.80 eV |

The "Property Value" entity in the paragraph is "-4.80 eV". It is the redox potential of the ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc+) salt couple, which is assumed to have an absolute energy level in a vacuum.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| -4.80 eV |

The only valid "Property Value" entity in the paragraph is "-4.80 eV", which is the redox potential of the ferrocene / ferrocenium (Fc / Fc+) salt couple. The other mentions of "oxidation potentials", "absolute energy level", and "vacuum" do not refer to specific values of material properties and are therefore not included in the table.
